awd_titl_txt: The Kinetics of Nucleated Wetting at Critical Liquid        Mixture Surfaces
awd_abstract_narration: 9223872  Law    This project will support research on the study of surface  nucleation and growth of droplets to a uniform film, called a  wetting layer, at liquid mixture surfaces.  The physics behind the  process of surface nucleation is not well understood, nor is the  coalescence of droplets to a uniform film on a surface well  understood.  It is important to gain an impordec understanding of  such phenomena because the existance of wetting layers on surfaces  is technologically very important, especially for solid surfaces.   Wetting layers on solid surfaces modigy the physical and chemical  properties of that surface.  They are important in such processes  as lubrication and tertiary oil recovery.  A better understanding  of the physics behind wetting layer formation will enable the  properties of these films to be controlled more precisely and also  enable the development of films with new and novel characteristics.  ***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
